learning_objective: Use lists to simplify solutions, generalizing computational problems instead of repeatedly using simple variables.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on a video production program. They use an array to store the duration of each scene in a video. Here is a snippet of Alex's code:Which of the following operations on 'sceneLengths' array could be used in Alex's code to add a new scene of 150 seconds at the end of the array?",
    "Answer1": "sceneLengths = 150",
    "Answer2": "sceneLengths[4] = 150",
    "Answer3": "sceneLengths[sceneLengths:Size] = 150",
    "Answer4": "sceneLengths:Add(150)",
    "CorrectAnswer": "4",
    "Explanation": "In Quorum programming language, the 'Add' operation is used to add a new element to the end of an array. The other options either overwrite an existing element in the array (option 2 and 3) or incorrectly attempt to assign a single value to the whole array (option 1).",
    "code_snippet": "integer[] sceneLengths\n\nsceneLengths:Add(120)\nsceneLengths:Add(60)\nsceneLengths:Add(90)\nsceneLengths:Add(180)"
}
